column29: CBI raids 76 locations, targeting tech support scams and cryptocurrency fraud. Scammers impersonated tech support for Microsoft and Amazon. Over 2000 customers affected. Scam ran for at least 5 years.

The Knight ransomware group claimed responsibility for the attack. The attack affected sensitive information including names, Aadhaar national IDs, mobile numbers, voter IDs, passports, and COVID-19 vaccination records.

The payment gateway of Safexpay Technology was hacked, resulting in the siphoning off of Rs 18,180 crore. The funds were transferred to hundreds of bank accounts, with Rs 25 crore being transferred to an HDFC Bank account of Real Enterprises. The total amount of money lost is estimated to be Rs 16,180 crore, with a portion transferred to foreign accounts.

column26: Karam Chand Thapar & Bros. (Coal Sales) Ltd
column29: The attack targeted Karam Chand Thapar & Bros. in India. The attackers demanded a ransom of $200,000. The company's website appeared to be operational, showing no visible signs of the attack on their front end.
